body_html:
Until the bug has been fixed with protobuf, a cleaner workaround might be to follow @jonparrott in protocolbuffers/protobuf#1296, namely to edit the source directory by

  1. Adding a new file tensorflow/google/init.py:
try:
    import pkg_resources
    pkg_resources.declare_namespace(__name__)
except ImportError:
    import pkgutil
    __path__ = pkgutil.extend_path(__path__, __name__)
  1. Add namespace_packages to tensorflow/google/protobuf/python/setup.py:
setup(
    name='protobuf',
    namespace_packages=['google'],
    ...
)
  1. Recompile / pip install. Good luck!

Adding a new file tensorflow/google/init.py:

Add namespace_packages to tensorflow/google/protobuf/python/setup.py:

setup(
    name='protobuf',

Recompile / pip install. Good luck!
body:
Until the bug has been fixed with protobuf, a cleaner workaround might be to follow @jonparrott in https://github.com/google/protobuf/issues/1296, namely to edit the source directory by
1. Adding a new file tensorflow/google/**init**.py:

```
try:
    import pkg_resources
    pkg_resources.declare_namespace(__name__)
except ImportError:
    import pkgutil
    __path__ = pkgutil.extend_path(__path__, __name__)
```
1. Add namespace_packages to tensorflow/google/protobuf/python/setup.py:

```
setup(
    name='protobuf',
    namespace_packages=['google'],
    ...
)
```
1. Recompile / pip install. Good luck!
